title: How to Make a Tiny Vampire Pumpkin

steps.headline: Measure the vampire teeth.
steps.description: Obtain both height and width measurements as you will need to not only create a wide enough opening inside the pumpkin, but one that is deep enough to accommodate the vampire teeth.

steps.headline: Transfer your measurements to the pumpkin using the pencil.
steps.description: Sketch the width directly on the pumpkin. Take depth into consideration so you know how deeply to make the initial cut.

steps.headline: Identify the area where the mouth should be located.You may want to pencil in where you will add the eyes to ascertain where the mouth will be located, typically toward the bottom of the pumpkin.
Create a pattern for the vampire teeth opening.
steps.description: Draw a dotted line that your knife can follow for the mouth area.

steps.headline: Cut out the mouth.
steps.description: Measure the depth on your knife so you know how deeply to cut. Carefully cut along the dotted line to create the mouth.

steps.headline: Remove the cut portion of the pumpkin.
steps.description:
Wiggle your knife around the sides of the pumpkin mouth to easily remove and dislodge the mouth area. Scrape the inside of the cut area to smooth the pumpkin flesh and create a neat pocket to hold the vampire teeth. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Create a flat surface along the bottom of the teeth area with your knife.
steps.description: Slide the knife along the bottom of the opening and smooth the area.

steps.headline: Insert the vampire teeth into the opening.
steps.description: If necessary, add a few dabs of glue toward the back of the teeth to hold them in place.

steps.headline: Add vampire eyes.
steps.description: Stick a long pin with the large red beaded head into each pencil eye marking. This will help the vampire to peer at people with his or her beady red eyes.

text:
Taking Measurements Measure the vampire teeth. Obtain both height and width measurements as you will need to not only create a wide enough opening inside the pumpkin, but one that is deep enough to accommodate the vampire teeth. Transfer your measurements to the pumpkin using the pencil. Sketch the width directly on the pumpkin. Take depth into consideration so you know how deeply to make the initial cut. Identify the area where the mouth should be located.You may want to pencil in where you will add the eyes to ascertain where the mouth will be located, typically toward the bottom of the pumpkin. Create a pattern for the vampire teeth opening. Draw a dotted line that your knife can follow for the mouth area. Cutting the Pumpkin Cut out the mouth. Measure the depth on your knife so you know how deeply to cut. Carefully cut along the dotted line to create the mouth. Remove the cut portion of the pumpkin. Wiggle your knife around the sides of the pumpkin mouth to easily remove and dislodge the mouth area. Scrape the inside of the cut area to smooth the pumpkin flesh and create a neat pocket to hold the vampire teeth. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/13\/Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tiny-Vampire-Pumpkin-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Create a flat surface along the bottom of the teeth area with your knife. Slide the knife along the bottom of the opening and smooth the area. Insert the vampire teeth into the opening. If necessary, add a few dabs of glue toward the back of the teeth to hold them in place. Add vampire eyes. Stick a long pin with the large red beaded head into each pencil eye marking. This will help the vampire to peer at people with his or her beady red eyes.
